devdoc.details: Only possible for a single policy for each wallet right now

params._tokenId: Policy ID which will also be the NFT token ID
Policy ID which will also be the NFT token ID

params.acceptedToken: superToken that is accepted for stream ( reference from Superfluid Docs )
params.cfa: Superfluid Central Flow Agreement Contract ( reference from Superfluid Docs )
params.govCA: contract address of the governance contract that handles the claim submission
params.host: Superfluid host contract ( reference from Superfluid Docs )
params.stakingCA: contract address of the staking contract that handles yield

params._policyId: Policy ID which will also be the NFT token ID

isActive(uint256).details: We are only able to handle 1 policy per holder, transfers will not terminate stream if the user did not manually delete flow but once the holder changes it should be reflected as non-active since there is no flow from the new holder

params._policyId: Policy ID which will also be the NFT token ID

params._baseAmount: Min fee that nuser needs to pay to own the policy (varies with coverage)
params._coverageAmount: Amount that user wants to be insured
params._minFlowRate: Min charges per second calculated from per day on the frontend
params._policyType: A combination of the category + specific type (e.g. VEHICLE-CAR)

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._tokenId: Policy ID which will also be the NFT token ID

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: SafeZen NFT contract with Superfluid

buildMetadata(uint256).notice: Builds the metadata required in accordance ot Opensea requirements

buildPolicy(uint256).notice: Builds the on-chain SVG for the specific policy

getHolder(uint256).notice: Retrieves the wallet address of the policy holder

isActive(uint256).notice: Retrieves the active state of the policy based on incoming flowRate from holder

tokenURI(uint256).notice: Calls on BuildMetadata -> BuildPolicy and return required format

userdoc.notice: The project allows users to be able to mint a specific policy that they need and stream only when they need to. An aggregated insurance provider platform, each Insurance policy requires a baseAmount and also a minFlowRate. The baseAmount is automatically staked when the user buys a policy through us and it generates our own  ERC20 Utility Token. This token can then be redeemed by the user (different % depending on whether they have claimed the insurance): Token can be used to subsidize future policy purchases
